resource.chars:
[as previous page] ...
# which is only common <u>Oil of Olives <\u>
& from its use with <u>Sallad <\u> is vulgarly 
known by ye name of <u>Sallad-oil <\u>
# recommends itself not only for its efficacy, but 
likewise on account of its being readily to be come 
at, when accidents happen there being no 
town or even Gentlemans house in ye country 
where <s>this medicine <\s> sallad oil is not at hand; whereas the 
oil of Vipers is never to be had, but at Apothe 
caries, & not one in an hundred of them keep it 
by them.
On ye first of June 1734. in the presence of a great 
number of persons the said Wm. Oliver was bit by
